page.title: 11Cupar Local News
page.content: The Labour{Euro M.P.}for Mid Scotland and Fife, Mr. Alex Falconer made a call for widespread{industrial action in support of{government}communication workers threatened with dismissal for belonging to a{trade union.}Visiting Hawklaw, Cupar, Mr. Falconer pledged the{5 union members}full Labour and {union}support.He attacked the {government,}saying that "the right to {union}membership is a basic human right". Earlier Mr. Falconer had met Cupar shoppers & later, at the Castlehill Community Centre, he expressed his views on the{E.E.C.}and the situation in Britain, concerned especially about the "trade imbalance" which was costing jobs.
